intro: Carpotroche apterocarpa, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces a fleshy, red or orange fruit that contains several seeds. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and unique foliage.
